Signature, Inscription and Stamp

Stamped at lower edge of plate, in center in blue: [MC (intertwined, monogram), Lugt 604]; Signed and inscribed by artist, in bottom margin, in pencil: [Imprimee par l\'artiste et M. Leroy / Mary Cassatt / 25 épreuves)]; inscribed in LLC, by later hand in pencil: [49]
markings: bottom center on plate, in blue: [MC (intertwined, monogram)]
provenance: [R.S. Johnson, Chicago]; Mary Lee Dayton, Wayzata, Minn. (until d. 2013; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LRC in bottom margin, in pencil: [Mary Cassatt]
text: Mary Cassatt began exhibiting with the French Impressionists in 1879, focusing much of her efforts on intimate portrayals of women and children. In addition to her sumptuous paintings and pastels, she became a highly accomplished printmaker, inspired largely by Japanese woodblock prints. The Bath is one of the artist’s most original and technically innovative works.
title: The Bath
